1. Neurogenic diabetes insipidus (DI): This is a chemical entity. Diabetes insipidus (DI) is a condition characterized by the excretion of large amounts of dilute urine and thirst. Neurogenic DI is a specific form of this condition that is caused by damage to the hypothalamus or pituitary gland, which disrupts the normal production and release of antidiuretic hormone (ADH).
2. Antidiuretic hormone (ADH): Although not explicitly mentioned in the paragraph, antidiuretic hormone (ADH) is an important chemical entity to consider in the context of neurogenic diabetes insipidus. ADH is a hormone produced by the hypothalamus and stored in the posterior pituitary gland. It helps regulate water balance in the body by controlling the amount of urine that is produced by the kidneys.
